resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

worklogs.comment:
mqy opened a new pull request #8924:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8924


   In rust/README.md,  both ARROW_TEST_DATA and PARQUET_TEST_DATA are set as relative path. The problem is: we MAY have to reset them back-and-forth across top and subdirectories – that's annoying. So, the obvious solution is: set the Env vars as absolute dirs.
   
   This PR also contains several minor fixes to spelling and format!

issuetype.description: A new unit, integration or system test.
issuetype.name: Test

fields.description: In rust/README.md,  both *ARROW_TEST_DATA* and *PARQUET_TEST_DATA* are set as relative path. The problem is: we MAY have to reset them back-and-forth across top and subdirectories -- that's annoying. So, the obvious solution is: set the Env vars as absolute dirs.
fields.summary: [Rust] Make ARROW_TEST_DATA and PARQUET_TEST_DATA absolute dirs
